intro: Euphrasia cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces small, yellowish flowers with distinctive spurred petals. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Euphrasia cuneata is often found in grassy areas, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
